p: The IPCC has not prescribed (explicitly) the 1.5°C or 2°C target as a threshold above which warming enters into an intolerable zone. The IPCC has however played a critical role in enacting the idea of a temperature threshold through the development of the ‘reasons for concern’ (RFC) framework and its associated visualisation in the ‘burning embers’ diagram (Mahony and Hulme 2012; Mahony 2015; O’Neill et al. 2017; Zommers et al. 2020).
